qas.question: How much was the total investment in renewable energy in 2012?
Why did the total investment in renewable energy go down in 2012?
What  six were the top countries for investment in recent years?

answers.text: China, Germany, Spain, the United States, Italy, and Brazil

qas.question: How much was the total investment in renewable energy in 2013?
Why did the total investment in renewable energy go up in 2012?
Why did the total investment in renewable energy go down in 2002?

plausible_answers.text: China, Germany, Spain, the United States, Italy, and Brazil

qas.question: What eight were the top countries for investment in recent years?

plausible_answers.text: China, Germany, Spain, the United States, Italy, and Brazil

qas.question: What six were the bottom countries for investment in recent years?

context: Total investment in renewable energy (including small hydro-electric projects) was <a0_0><b3_0>$244 billion<b3_0/><a0_0/> in 2012, down 12% from 2011 mainly due to <a1_0><b4_0><b5_0>dramatically lower solar prices<b5_0/><b4_0/><a1_0/> and weakened US and EU markets. As a share of total investment in power plants, wind and solar PV grew from 14% in 2000 to over 60% in 2012. The top countries for investment in recent years were <a2_0><b6_0><b7_0>China, Germany, Spain, the United States, Italy, and Brazil<b7_0/><b6_0/><a2_0/>. Renewable energy companies include BrightSource Energy, First Solar, Gamesa, GE Energy, Goldwind, Sinovel, Trina Solar, Vestas and Yingli.
